alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Goshen and east central Platte Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Jay Em to near Guernsey. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Guernsey, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Prairie Center, Jay Em, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Guernsey Campground, Hartville and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
